intro: Vellozia torquata, commonly known as the twisted vellozia, is a unique succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthophyllaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, twisted, spiral-like growth pattern. The plant features narrow, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a delicate touch to its rugged appearance. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
